Base image of CentOS 7. Allows both standard StratusLab and cloud-init contextualization mechanisms. Disk space is 15 GB.

Ubuntu 14.04 base 15G disk image automatically created by StratusLab. Configured only with a root user. The firewall in the image is disabled, IPv6 is enabled, and SELinux disabled. Allows both standard StratusLab and cloud-init contextualization mechanisms. No swap is provided.

Cloud testing image, minimal functionality, minimal size, minimal security (widely known root password). Do not use for production !

General bioinformatics compute appliance built by CNRS IFB. The
            following bioinformatics tools are installed and available from the command line: abyss,
            blast+, bioconductor, bowtie, bowtie2, bwa, cap3, clustal-omega, clustalw2, fasta36,
            gor4, hmm, meme, mmseq, multalin, muscle, predator, ray, R, samtools, simpa96, tophat,
            tophat2. To log in, use ssh with your key and the 'root' account. The appliance
            automatically mount the cloud IFB-public databases repository. This appliance also mount
            your persistent disk at boot time.

Ubuntu 12.04 base image automatically created by StratusLab. Configured only with a root user. The firewall in the image is disabled, IPv6 is enabled, and SELinux disabled. Allows both standard StratusLab and cloud-init contextualization mechanisms. A swap volume is expected to be provided on /dev/sdb.

CentOS 6.5 base image automatically created by StratusLab. Configured only with a root user. The firewall in the image is disabled, IPv6 is enabled, and SELinux disabled. Allows both standard StratusLab and cloud-init contextualization mechanisms. A swap volume is expected to be provided on /dev/vdb.
